title: Pyongyang awards medal to American aid worker
content: North Korea has awarded a medal for the first time to a US citizen, for his efforts to provide the country with food and medical supplies, a report said yesterday. Pyongyang has posthumously awarded its friendship medal to Ellsworth Culver, co-founder of the charity Mercy Corps, South Korea's Yonhap news agency reported, quoting a Korean newspaper in the US. North Korea's UN diplomat, Han Song-ryol, gave the medal to Culver's widow in Oregon. He called Culver a pioneer "who made efforts to achieve a new development of North Korea-US relations". Culver died last year aged 78.
summary:
North Korea has awarded a medal for the first time to a US citizen, for his efforts to provide the country with food and medical supplies, a report said yesterday.
Pyongyang has posthumously awarded its friendship medal to Ellsworth Culver, co-founder of the charity Mercy Corps, South Korea's Yonhap news agency reported, quoting a Korean newspaper in the US.
North Korea's UN diplomat, Han Song-ryol, gave the medal to Culver's widow in Oregon.
He called Culver a pioneer "who made efforts to achieve a new development of North Korea-US relations".
Culver died last year aged 78.
